intro: Sitanion brevifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sitanion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered umbels of white flowers. The plant has finely divided, narrow leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Sitanion brevifolium is an important nectar source for native pollinators and is valued for its ecological role in arid ecosystems.
